intro: Crambella, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ranunculaceae. It consists of several species native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants are characterized by their simple, alternate leaves and showy, often yellow or white flowers. They typically grow in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Crambella species are valued for their ornamental appeal and have historical uses in herbal medicine.
